result.description: D2.4 AUTOWARE Data Management and Distribution (M21, M30). This document will describe AUTOWARE’s proposals for self-adaptive and cognitive-based data management and distribution schemes designed to enhance the reconfigurability of automation processes.

result.title: Specific national business cases
result.description: To help exploiting the project results in Europe, several business cases (case studies) will be developed to support the further implementation of electrolysers integrated in grids with renewable generation. Models and strategies will be developed to solve possible bottlenecks, for example relating to capital, permitting, etc

result.title: First strategy plan for commercial exploitation of the results
result.description: Each partner will generate exploitable results and be responsible for the exploitation; however, the most important synergies can be achieved by a common and long term exploitation strategy aimed at wider implementation of the electrolyser components and systems developed. The first strategy plan will contain the detailed definition of the exploitable results

result.title: Final strategy plan for commercial exploitation of the results
result.description: Each partner will generate exploitable results and be responsible for the exploitation; however, the most important synergies can be achieved by a common and long term exploitation strategy aimed at wider implementation of the electrolyser components and systems developed. After the second exploitation meeting, D6.7 will include the development of the exploitation strategy and business plan.

result.title: Development of single and secondary effect hazard assessment methodologies including uncertainty quantification and comparison
result.description: This deliverable will provide methods to analyse extreme hazards using multi-varied statistics and to account for secondary hazards associated with each NPP component separately using physical approaches. On the other hand, it will present a stochastic approach to scenario development, allowing characterization of the hazard curve to integrate all possible uncertainty, temporal and spatial combinations for Design Basis Events (see task 1.3 for details).
